title: Novaux Bundles Epson Printers With Its Windows POS Solution For Restaurants
text:
Novaux Bundles Epson Printers With Its Windows POS Solution For Restaurants 
Joint Solution Delivers Essential Components for a Complete Mobile POS System for Windows Users 
Epson America, Inc., a leading supplier of value-added Point of Sale (POS) solutions, recently announced that Novaux, developer of Sabor POS, a restaurant POS platform for Windows 8 and 10, has certified Epson’s OmniLink® TM-T88V-i and TM-T20II-i smart printers, and the TM-T20II POS receipt printer. Novaux is in the process of evaluating Epson’s TM-U220 receipt/kitchen printer and the Mobilink P20 and P80 mobile printers as well. The company is using the certified Epson printers to bring a completely integrated POS solution to their restaurant customers. The joint solution is available from Novaux today. 
The Epson OmniLink T20II-i and T88V-i are used as the primary receipt printers for Novaux’s dine-in restaurants. The printers’ unique ePOS™ technology enables Novaux’s Sabor POS platform to communicate directly with connected peripherals such as scanners, scales and customer displays at the restaurant site. Novaux is using the Epson TM-T20II Ethernet version as a kitchen printer. 
“Novaux has created a restaurant POS platform that gives restaurant managers who are using Windows devices the same functionality as those who are using iPad POS systems,” said Tom Kettell, director, commercial channel sales at Epson. “We are proud to partner with such a forward looking company that is leading the way in making sure Windows users can benefit from the best POS solutions as well.” 
“Epson’s leading POS printer solutions are the ideal fit for our Sabor POS platform,” said Javier Dutan, CEO at Novaux. “Our platform is designed with the new “modern” interface cues and built specifically for the missing POS gap in the Windows marketplace. Epson printers support all the leading operating systems, including Windows, so together, we can provide the Windows community with real POS tools.” 
Epson OmniLink TM-T88V-i and TM-T20II-i With built-in processing power and unique ePOS technology, Epson’s OmniLink solutions support web-based printing from virtually any mobile device with no print drivers, plug-ins, PCs or costly application changes. They also enable mobile devices to communicate directly with peripherals connected to OmniLink TM-T88V-i, such as a bump bar, kitchen display or up to 20 slave kitchen printers. 
Epson TM-T20II POS Receipt Printer Epson’s tablet POS-friendly TM-T20II is fast, reliable and supports all the leading mobile operating systems including iOS, Android and Windows. It features printing up to 200mm/second, high reliability, multiple ease-of-use features, dual interfaces and print options that reduce paper usage up to 30%. 
For more information, visit http://www.epson.com/cgi-bin/Store/jsp/pos/index.do 
About Novaux Located in New York City, NY, Novaux is the developer of Sabor POS, a full house restaurant management systems for Windows 8 and 10. Sabor POS specializes in restaurant management and sales with restaurant features such as ticket merging, table splitting, and more. Sabor POS can be fully utilized in the kitchen to track food prep times, front house and back house communication, and response times from food, to kitchen, to table. Sabor POS can also be used as a full cash register replacement for current restaurant solutions. For more information, visit http://www.saborpos.com 
About Epson America, Inc. Founded in 1975 and headquartered in Long Beach, CA, Epson America, Inc. is the U.S. affiliate of Japan-based Seiko Epson Corporation, a global manufacturer and supplier of high-quality technology products that meet customer demands for increased functionality, compactness, systems integration and energy efficiency. For over 40 years, Epson’s advanced technology has been at work in millions of POS systems around the world. Today Epson’s Business Systems Division continues to bring industry-leading, open architecture, smart technologies to the point of service.
